title: Registry Entry
description: An entry describing an entity in a registry.

entityId.description: The public id of the organization in the registry entry. These values may be unique, but unlike `entityIndex` are not necessarily unique (see `subsidiaryId`).

subsidiaryId.description: Identification of an organization nested within another organization. It is assumed that `entityId` + `subsidiaryId` form unique value pairs for each record.

associatedEntityIds.description: A list of associated organizations using their registry id.

entityIndex.description: The internal index of the organization in the registry entry. It is assumed that these values are unique.

recordId.description: The id of the record in the registry entry. If there are multiple records for different years, this id should be different for each record.

recordIndex.description: The internal index of the record in the registry entry. This is used when there already is a `recordId` that represents a broader public identification but there also is an identification system internal to the registry.

websiteUrl.description: The official url of the organization as listed in the registry entry.

registryName.description: The name of the registry where the entry was retrieved from.

sourceData.description: A representation of the original data in the context of the original source.

dateAccessed.description: The date the source was accessed. If the source is a copy, this is the date the local file was copied from the authoritative source.

sourceUrl.description: The original source URL if applicable. (Maybe this should generalize to include file name?)

retrivalMethod.description: The tool used (i.e. Jupyter Notebook name) used to extract data from the source.

rawData.description: A representation of the original data.
